content: Don't know why the bot is waiting for a merged PR to be merged, so this one is ready for review even though the check doesn't say so.

I was rather uninspired for the names, so I would love to hear suggestions on how to call

  • the relation a ≤ b ∧ b ≤ a
  • the partial order which you get by quotienting a preorder by the aforementioned relation.
I can also not name that relation and use (≤) ⊓ swap (≤) if you want me to

I don't have a strong objection to le_equiv, although I agree that there's probably a better name out there, but I really dislike antisymmetrization. Eric R suggests preorder.force_partial which I think is better but still not great. Maybe to_antisymm? Suggestions appreciated!
The thing is that to_antisymm says nothing of the fact that the relation is an order, although one could argue that everything generalizes to any reflexive transitive relation.
I'm just trying to get away from the instance names.
